Articles.Content:
A bug has been reported (and I confirmed) that the Toolbar button is not being displayed, but a small black box is.

This makes the toolbar unusable.

I am looking at it, but not sure what's going on yet

4 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

A bug has been reported (and I confirmed) that the Toolbar button is not being displayed, but a small black box is.

This makes the toolbar unusable.

I am looking at it, but not sure what's going on yet

I don't know if another log would help your diagnostics but here's one anyway.

Log

Thanks for the log, but in this case, i didn't need it.

I just released an update for the Blizzy toolbar which fixes the problem

For those interested, it was a result of a change in the way float comparisions were being done, and something which used to work was now broken

New release, 0.1.9.3

  • Updated MiniAVC.dll to 1.4.0.2 to fix a nasty CTD
  • Some optimization work on related to the stock toolbar code, reduces the number of calls Unity makes every frame
Sorry for being  a complete n00b, but which verion is working with 1.6.1?

4 hours ago, Fredde104 said:

Sorry for being  a complete n00b, but which verion is working with 1.6.1?

Should be this one https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/ToolbarControl/releases/tag/0.1.7

On 10/27/2019 at 2:59 AM, linuxgurugamer said:

New release, 0.1.9.3

I was wondering why AVC didn't pick it up.  http://ksp.spacetux.net/avc/ToolbarControl reports version 1.8.2 as latest release.

Hi, I'm having a weird issue.

I'm running KSP 1.6.1 for my Realism Overhaul playthrough, and CKAN installed Toolbar Controller 0.1.8.2, even though I notice it was said in a recent post that 0.1.7 is the release that should be for 1.6.1. Although the mod itself seems to be working, I am getting this spammed in console many many times per second that seems to be causing some lag: (pasting URL as for some reason the forums won't allow me to insert it from HTML)

https://imgur.com/2Lox8oS

 

CKAN gave me 1.7.19 version of the toolbar, which seems to be the correct one for 1.6.1

I did try manually replacing the Toolbar Controller version with 0.1.7 as the post said a couple of replies ago, but doing this stopped about half a dozen mods from showing up in the controller, most importantly Kerbal Construction Time, which then wouldn't show up on either toolbar and was spamming its own error in console about not being able to load something about the game state. Forgot to screenshot that one. So I changed back to the 0.1.8.2 version and everything is back to normal, including the error message spam I showed in the image above.

Is there a newer version of Blizzy Toolbar I should update to even though its for a newer version of KSP? I would like to get rid of the console messages :s 

 

Edited December 7, 2019 by PhilMcgroin
Spelling!

1 hour ago, PhilMcgroin said:

Hi, I'm having a weird issue.

I'm running KSP 1.6.1 for my Realism Overhaul playthrough, and CKAN installed Toolbar Controller 0.1.8.2, even though I notice it was said in a recent post that 0.1.7 is the release that should be for 1.6.1. Although the mod itself seems to be working, I am getting this spammed in console many many times per second that seems to be causing some lag: (pasting URL as for some reason the forums won't allow me to insert it from HTML)

https://imgur.com/2Lox8oS

 

CKAN gave me 1.7.19 version of the toolbar, which seems to be the correct one for 1.6.1

I did try manually replacing the Toolbar Controller version with 0.1.7 as the post said a couple of replies ago, but doing this stopped about half a dozen mods from showing up in the controller, most importantly Kerbal Construction Time, which then wouldn't show up on either toolbar and was spamming its own error in console about not being able to load something about the game state. Forgot to screenshot that one. So I changed back to the 0.1.8.2 version and everything is back to normal, including the error message spam I showed in the image above.

Is there a newer version of Blizzy Toolbar I should update to even though its for a newer version of KSP? I would like to get rid of the console messages :s 

 

Log file, please.  I'll have to check to see what's going on with CKAN, and then maybe get out an update for the toolbarcontroller for KSP 1.7.3 and earlier

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13pfs51psO1guAycSFO15NMccmYNTehBZ - Output_log.txt

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1WJEW-vGyrvNzIsmJsWp5sTZfJHBSLwAy - KSP.txt

Those are the logs with 0.1.8.2 installed, the one that works except for the console spam. If you want logs from having 0.1.7 installed that breaks everything let me know and I'll switch them back quickly and get those

2 hours ago, PhilMcgroin said:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13pfs51psO1guAycSFO15NMccmYNTehBZ - Output_log.txt

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1WJEW-vGyrvNzIsmJsWp5sTZfJHBSLwAy - KSP.txt

Those are the logs with 0.1.8.2 installed, the one that works except for the console spam. If you want logs from having 0.1.7 installed that breaks everything let me know and I'll switch them back quickly and get those

That Output_log.txt is from KSP 1.3.1: 


[KSP Version]: 1.3.1.1891 (WindowsPlayer x64) (x64) en-us ==============================

 

I have an indication that you may have two copies of the ToolbarControl installed: 

[LOG 09:04:55.633] ADDON BINDER: Create binding redirect: ToolbarControl, Version=0.1.7.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null => ToolbarControl, Version=0.1.8.2, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

[LOG 09:04:55.698] ADDON BINDER: Create binding redirect: ToolbarControl, Version=0.1.6.17, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null => ToolbarControl, Version=0.1.8.2, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Or something else, I'm not sure.  I really need the correct output_log.txt

 

Edit:  From what I can tell, you have ToolbarController 0.1.8.2 installed, which is the last version for anything prior to 1.8

You have version 1.7.19 installed of the Blizzy toolbar, you need to install 1.7.22.2, you can get it here:

https://spacedock.info/mod/2090/Toolbar/download/1.7.22.2

or here:

https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/ksp_toolbar/releases/tag/1.7.22.2

 

Edited December 8, 2019 by linuxgurugamer

On 12/8/2019 at 12:52 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

That Output_log.txt is from KSP 1.3.1:

Well I'm a dummy. I didn't realize the location had moved to AppData. 

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13pfs51psO1guAycSFO15NMccmYNTehBZ

This is the actual one. However, I think it is now redundant as you managed to spot the issue even with the old log.

On 12/8/2019 at 12:52 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

I have an indication that you may have two copies of the ToolbarControl installed:

Probably also due to the wrong log, because there's definitely only one version in my gamedata folder

On 12/8/2019 at 12:52 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

You have version 1.7.19 installed of the Blizzy toolbar, you need to install 1.7.22.2, you can get it here

This upgrade fixed the problem, no more console spam. Looking for the right version was actually the first thing I tried, but the fact that CKAN had suggested 1.7.19, (and the fact that 1.7.22.2 said in its version file that was for 1.7.1 when I manually checked) threw me off the scent! 

So I guess something needs a slight tweak in whatever CKAN is tweaked by so that it spits out the correct one for 1.6.1

https://gyazo.com/a9e826d3b84e76301d6a0ce10e6945eb

 

Either way, the upgrade fixed it. Thanks so much for the help!

Edited December 9, 2019 by PhilMcgroin
I'm dumb and realized after I posted that output_log had moved houses!

When I use Toolbar Controller, a pink rectangle appears on either the engine or capsule.  Removing this controller removes the rectangle.  Unfortunately, Toolbar Controller is required for Editor Extensions Redux, which I really like.  Without Toolbar Controller, EER the X-key and C-key fail.

Has anyone else reported this pink rectangle?  If so, was there a solution?  I'm using the latest versions of Toolbar Controller and Toolbar.

Edited February 19, 2020 by Apollo13

1 hour ago, Apollo13 said:

When I use Toolbar Controller, a pink rectangle appears on either the engine or capsule.  Removing this controller removes the rectangle.  Unfortunately, Toolbar Controller is required for Editor Extensions Redux, which I really like.  Without Toolbar Controller, EER the X-key and C-key fail.

Has anyone else reported this pink rectangle?  If so, was there a solution?  I'm using the latest versions of Toolbar Controller and Toolbar.  I'm using Toolbar without Toolbar Controller.

The ping rectangle is from a bad shader.  Toolbar Controller does not do anything with shaders.

There has to be another mod involved.  Please provide a log file for analysis

And, suddenly, the pink rectangle is gone.  I did nothing.  Bonus:  Part Commander is working; it previously failed as well.

EDIT:  However, in EER, the X-key and C-key still fail. 

player.log here==> player.log file

Edited February 19, 2020 by Apollo13

3 hours ago, Apollo13 said:

And, suddenly, the pink rectangle is gone.  I did nothing.  Bonus:  Part Commander is working; it previously failed as well.

EDIT:  However, in EER, the X-key and C-key still fail. 

player.log here==> player.log file

I just tested Editor Extensions Redux, the x and c keys are working well.  Not sure what your problem is, I'll look at the log file later

4 hours ago, Apollo13 said:

EDIT:  However, in EER, the X-key and C-key still fail. 

This randomly happens to me, as well. In the KSP input settings (from main menu), they get cleared out from time to time. I've never been able to figure out what causes it. I just go re-assign them whenever it happens. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

1 minute ago, leatherneck6017 said:

This randomly happens to me, as well. In the KSP input settings (from main menu), they get cleared out from time to time. I've never been able to figure out what causes it. I just go re-assign them whenever it happens. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Sounds like mods fighting over the key assignments? any idea if theres another mod that opens when this happens?.. or at least any obvious effect in-game whn those keys are used? vOv

1 minute ago, Stone Blue said:

Sounds like mods fighting over the key assignments? any idea if theres another mod that opens when this happens?.. or at least any obvious effect in-game whn those keys are used? vOv

That was my original thought, but at some point I went through my 150+ active mods and couldn't find a conflict. I wonder if KSP itself gets confused, as both of those keys have function in flight.

2 hours ago, leatherneck6017 said:

This randomly happens to me, as well. In the KSP input settings (from main menu), they get cleared out from time to time. I've never been able to figure out what causes it. I just go re-assign them whenever it happens. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

There is actually an option in the EEX popup menu to reset them.  Specifically because of this

6 hours ago, Apollo13 said:

And, suddenly, the pink rectangle is gone.  I did nothing.  Bonus:  Part Commander is working; it previously failed as well.

EDIT:  However, in EER, the X-key and C-key still fail. 

player.log here==> player.log file

See above

@linuxgurugamer Just out of curiosity, is there a way to custom order the mod buttons in the stock toolbar with toolbar controller{or some other way to do it that i don't know about}? sort of group the mod buttons together that i use most frequently, so i'm not scrolling through the list like mad trying to find them in a hurry, I can just stick my autopilot, alarmclock, waypoint manager, and science alert buttons at the top of the list and be done with it?
I found the button to  reset the keys.  X and C now work.  No pink rectangle.  THANK you

9 hours ago, vardicd said:

@linuxgurugamer Just out of curiosity, is there a way to custom order the mod buttons in the stock toolbar with toolbar controller{or some other way to do it that i don't know about}? sort of group the mod buttons together that i use most frequently, so i'm not scrolling through the list like mad trying to find them in a hurry, I can just stick my autopilot, alarmclock, waypoint manager, and science alert buttons at the top of the list and be done with it? 

Not easily

29 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Not easily

fair enough, just thought I'd ask

7 minutes ago, vardicd said:

fair enough, just thought I'd ask

Sorry, I was on mobile.

There are two issues which would need to be addressed:

  1. Rearranging the toolbar to your liking
  2. Keeping the toolbar rearranged

All this without having too much of an impact on the game.
